note_text:
Indications: Pulmonary nodule requiring diagnosis/staging. 
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the pre-procedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The laryngeal mask airway was in good position. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea was of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level without endobronchial lesions visualized. Anatomy was normal with exception of fish mouth dynamic obstruction of the right middle lobe. The bronchoscope was then removed and the P190 ultrathin video bronchoscope was inserted into the airway and advanced into the apical segment of the right upper lobe were endobronchial tumor was visualized.  The radial EBUS probe was inserted through the bronchoscope and advanced into the airway and an eccentric view of the lesion was identified. Biopsies were then performed with a variety of instruments to include peripheral needle forceps and brush. ROSE identified malignancy. After adequate samples were obtained, the video bronchoscope was then removed and the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. A systematic hilar and mediastinal lymph node survey was carried out. Sampling criteria (5mm short axis diameter) was only met in station station 4R and 11Rs. Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed using an Olympus EBUSTBNA 22 gauge needle. All samples were sent for routine cytology. Onsite path evaluation showed adequate lymphocytes in the 4R lymph node and were non-diagnostic in the 11Rs. The bronchoscope was then removed and the P190 ultrathin video bronchoscope was inserted again into the airway and 5 more forceps biopsies were obtained in the apical segment of the right upper lobe for cell block and molecular analysis. The bronchoscope was then removed and the Q190 re-inserted into the airways. DECAMP research samples were then performed with brushing within the right upper lobe, right middle lobe and transbronchial biopsies in the RUL, RML and LUL. We then observed for evidence of active bleeding and none was identified. The bronchoscope was removed and the procedure completed. 

Complications: 	
-None 
Estimated Blood Loss:  5 cc.
Recommendations:
- Transfer to post-procedure unit
- Await biopsy results 
- Discharge home once criteria met.

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Normal vocal cords, trachea, carina. RML dynamic obstruction (fish mouth). Endobronchial tumor visualized in RUL apical segment.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS sampling, 1-2 nodal stations
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s) (add-on)
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), each additional lobe (add-on)

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS sampling, 1-2 nodal stations
lines.selection_reason: Linear EBUS-TBNA performed on 2 stations (4R, 11R). Highest valued code in family.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
lines.selection_reason: Transbronchial biopsies performed in RUL (clinical) and DECAMP protocol (RUL/RML/LUL). 31628 covers the first lobe.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), each additional lobe (add-on)
lines.selection_reason: Transbronchial biopsies performed in two additional lobes (RML, LUL) for DECAMP protocol.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with brushing or protected brushings
lines.selection_reason: Bundled into primary biopsy (31628) as sampling of the same lobe(s).

lines.description: EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s) (add-on)
lines.selection_reason: Radial EBUS used to localize RUL lesion (eccentric view).

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; diagnostic, with cell washing
lines.selection_reason: Diagnostic bronchoscopy is bundled when therapeutic procedures (31652, 31628) are performed.

lines.description: Moderate sedation
lines.selection_reason: Anesthesia (propofol infusion) provided by anesthesia assistance; proceduralist cannot bill moderate sedation.

rules_applied.details: Diagnostic bronchoscopy 31622 is bundled into the more extensive procedures performed (31652, 31628).
Both Linear EBUS (31652) and Radial EBUS (+31654) are reportable as they targeted distinct sites (Mediastinal LNs vs Peripheral RUL Nodule).
Multiple Endoscopy Rule applies: 31652 paid at 100%, subsequent codes (31628, 31623) subject to reduction.

metadata.notes: Research samples (DECAMP) included in billing as they represent distinct anatomic work (TBLB in RML/LUL) not otherwise captured by clinical samples. Verify payer policy on research vs clinical billing.

note_text:
Indications: Pulmonary nodule requiring diagnosis/staging. 
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the pre-procedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The laryngeal mask airway was in good position. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea was of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first sub-segmental level without endobronchial lesions visualized. The video bronchoscope was then removed and the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. A systematic hilar and mediastinal lymph node survey was carried out. Sampling criteria (5mm short axis diameter) was met in station 11RS and 7. Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed using an Olympus EBUSTBNA 22 gauge needle. Further details regarding nodal size and number of samples are included in the EBUS procedural sheet in AHLTA. All samples were sent for routine cytology. Onsite path evaluation did not identify malignancy. The bronchoscope was then removed and the T190 therapeutic video bronchoscope was inserted into the airway and based on anatomical knowledge advanced into the left upper lobe and a large sheeth catheter with radial ultrasoung to the area of known nodule and a concentric view of the lesion was identified with the radial EBUS. Biopsies were then performed with a variety of instruments to include peripheral needle forceps and brush with fluoroscopic guidance through the sheath. After adequate samples were obtained the bronchoscope was removed. ROSE did not identify malignancy on preliminary samples.  The bronchoscope was then removed and the Q190 re-inserted into the airways. To remove secretions and blood and once confident that there was no active bleeding the bronchoscope was removed and the procedure completed. 

Complications: 	
-None 
Estimated Blood Loss:  10 cc.
Recommendations:
- Admit for overnight observation given the late hour of procedural completion
- Await biopsy results 
- Discharge home once criteria met.

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Normal vocal cords, subglottic space, trachea, and carina. No endobronchial lesions.

outcomes.preliminary_diagnosis: Pulmonary nodule, no malignancy identified on ROSE
outcomes.follow_up_plan_text: Admit for overnight observation. Await biopsy results. Discharge home once criteria met.

linear_ebus_stations_detail.notes: Station 11RS in text mapped to 11R. Sampled.

navigation_targets.notes: Localization via anatomical knowledge and radial EBUS. Fluoroscopic guidance used.

note_spans.snippet: radial ultrasound to the area... concentric view

lines.description: Bronchoscopy with TBNA
lines.selection_reason: Bundled with 31628 for sampling the same lesion (LUL nodule). Standard is to bill the most extensive sampling method (Tissue Biopsy > Aspiration).

lines.description: Bronchoscopy with brushing
lines.selection_reason: Bundled with 31628 for sampling the same lesion.

lines.description: Diagnostic bronchoscopy
lines.selection_reason: Bundled into surgical bronchoscopy procedures (31652/31628).

lines.description: Navigation Bronchoscopy
lines.selection_reason: No electromagnetic or robotic navigation system (e.g., Ion, SuperDimension) was documented. 'Anatomical knowledge' does not qualify for +31627.

lines.description: Fluoroscopy
lines.selection_reason: Fluoroscopy is inherent to bronchoscopy codes per NCCI.

financial_analysis.mppr_assumptions: Primary 31652 at 100%. Secondary 31628 reduced by 50% of the difference between its full value and base endoscopy value (31622). +31654 is add-on, paid at 100%.

per_code.summary: Selected for EBUS-TBNA of 2 stations (11R and 7). Primary procedure due to highest Work RVU (4.46).

documentation_evidence.snippet: Sampling criteria... met in station 11RS and 7. Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration...

per_code.summary: Selected for Transbronchial Lung Biopsy (forceps) of the LUL nodule. Distinct anatomic site from EBUS (parenchyma vs mediastinum).

documentation_evidence.snippet: Biopsies were then performed... to include peripheral needle forceps

per_code.summary: Selected for Radial EBUS localization of the LUL nodule. Requires primary bronchoscopy code (31628).

documentation_evidence.snippet: large sheeth catheter with radial ultrasoung to the area of known nodule and a concentric view

rules_applied.details: 31628 is subject to MPPR reduction as a secondary endoscopy code.

rules_applied.description: Navigation code +31627 requires specific navigation system usage.
rules_applied.details: Note describes 'anatomical knowledge' and 'radial ultrasound' but no EMN system.

global_comments: EBUS-TBNA (31652) and TBLB (31628) are distinct procedures targeting different anatomic sites (Lymph Nodes vs Lung Parenchyma).
TBNA (31629) and Brushing (31623) of the LUL nodule are bundled into TBLB (31628) for the same lesion.
Radial EBUS (+31654) is supported by documentation of concentric view and sampling.
No moderate sedation coded as anesthesia was provided (Propofol/MAC).

metadata.notes: Procedure included EBUS and Radial-EBUS guided TBLB. Navigation system not used.

note_text:
Indications: Pulmonary Nodule
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the pre-procedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The arytenoids were large with a large and floppy epiglottis. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. Tracheomalacia was noted as we advanced the scope to the carina. The carina was sharp. The right and left sided airway anatomy was normal. No evidence of endobronchial disease was seen to at least the first sub-segments.  We then removed the bronchoscope and inserted the EBUS bronchoscope into the airway. We attempted to visualize the nodule with endobronchial ultrasound but did not see the nodule with ultrasound. We then inserted the therapeutic bronchoscope for electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy.  We were not able to get to the nodule using the navigation equipment.  After suctioning blood and secretions and once we were confident that there was no active bleeding the bronchoscope was removed and the procedure completed.

Complications: None.
Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 10 cc.  No specimens were obtained for path review.
Post Procedure Diagnosis:
- Discuss his case at cardiothoracic tumor board next Tuesday to determine best next step in workup

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Arytenoids large, epiglottis large/floppy. Tracheomalacia noted to carina. Normal distal airways.

navigation_targets.notes: Attempted to visualize with EBUS but not seen. Unable to get to nodule using navigation equipment.

outcomes.procedure_aborted_reason: Unable to reach target / visualize with ultrasound

lines.description: Bronchoscopy, diagnostic, with cell washing
lines.selection_reason: Primary diagnostic inspection performed. No biopsies were successfully obtained to support a higher-level code.

note_spans.snippet: Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced... advanced to the tracheobronchial tree.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with computer-assisted, image-guided navigation
lines.selection_reason: Navigation was initiated ('inserted the therapeutic bronchoscope for electromagnetic navigation') even though target was not reached. Professional work of planning and attempt is reportable.

note_spans.snippet: inserted the therapeutic bronchoscope for electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy

per_code.summary: Selected as primary because full inspection was performed but no biopsy (31625/31628) or sampling was successful.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced... Tracheomalacia was noted... No evidence of endobronchial disease

per_code.summary: Navigation system usage documented. Although the nodule was not reached, the code covers the professional work of planning and procedure initiation.

documentation_evidence.snippet: inserted the therapeutic bronchoscope for electromagnetic navigation bronchoscopy

rules_applied.description: Usually 31622 bundles into surgical codes, but here no surgical codes were completed, so 31622 stands as primary.
Anesthesia provided Propofol; moderate sedation (99152) dropped.
Radial EBUS (+31654) dropped because the nodule was not visualized ('did not see the nodule with ultrasound'), making the service incomplete/nondiagnostic.

metadata.notes: Procedure unsuccessful in reaching target. No specimens.

note_text:
Indications: Pulmonary Nodule
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the pre-procedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The arytenoids were large with a large and floppy epiglottis. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea is of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. On the right the patient had an anatomic variant with an accessory airway just distal to the superior segment of the right lower lobe. The left sided airway anatomy was normal. No evidence of endobronchial disease was seen to at least the first sub-segments.  We then removed the bronchoscope and inserted the P190 slim bronchoscope into the airway. We attempted to visualize endobronchial disease within the anterior basilar segment of the left lower lobe but could not advance the scope distally enough. We then inserted the radial ultrasound through the working channel of the bronchoscope and an eccentric view of the kno0wn nodule was obtained. We then performed peripheral TBNAs of the point of interest. ROSE did not show obvious malignancy. At this point we removed the slim scope and inserted the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope through the mouth, and advanced into the tracheobronchial tree. We attempted to wedge the scope in the lower lobe to potentially visualize the tumor with ultrasound. We saw an unusual area of soft tissue which did not obviously look like would be expected from the nodule. Two biopsies were performed using the 22G EBUS-TBNA needle. ROSE however showed only blood. Finally, fluoroscopy was brought into the room and the T190 therapeutic video bronchoscope was inserted into the airway and based on anatomical knowledge advanced into the left lower lobe and a large sheath catheter with radial ultrasound to the area of known nodule and a concentric view of the lesion was identified with the radial EBUS. Biopsies were then performed with a variety of instruments to include peripheral needle forceps and brush with fluoroscopic guidance through the sheath. After adequate samples were obtained the bronchoscope was removed. ROSE did not identify malignancy on preliminary samples.  After suctioning blood and secretions and once we were confident that there was no active bleeding the bronchoscope was removed and the procedure completed.
Following completion of the procedure the patient was noted to have audible upper airway sounds and ventilation was difficult.  And decision was made to convert to endotracheal intubation. Initially this was attempted over the bronchoscope however edema within the structures of the middle laryngeal cavity (above the vocal cords this was unsuccessful. Anesthesia was then able to intubate with the glideslope. The bronchoscope was then inserted through the ETT to confirm positioning 2cm above the carina and to suction secretions. The patient was then transferred to the ICU. 

Complications: Unexpected admission
Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 10 cc.
Post Procedure Diagnosis:
- Flexible bronchoscopy with successful biopsy of left lower lobe pulmonary nodule
- Will transfer to the ICU and attempt extubation later today. 
- Await final pathology

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Arytenoids large with floppy epiglottis. Normal vocal cords, subglottic space, and trachea. Sharp carina. Right accessory airway distal to RLL superior segment. No endobronchial disease.

complications.other_complication_details: Audible upper airway sounds, difficult ventilation, laryngeal edema. Unplanned endotracheal intubation and ICU admission.

outcomes.follow_up_plan_text: Transfer to ICU, attempt extubation later today. Await pathology.

per_code.summary: Primary code for EBUS-guided needle aspiration of the LLL mass. Selected because CP-EBUS scope was used for targeting and sampling.

documentation_evidence.snippet: inserted the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope... Two biopsies were performed using the 22G EBUS-TBNA needle.

per_code.summary: Transbronchial lung biopsy of the peripheral nodule using forceps. Distinct sampling method from needle aspiration.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Biopsies were then performed with a variety of instruments to include peripheral needle forceps

documentation_evidence.snippet: Biopsies were then performed... include... brush with fluoroscopic guidance

per_code.summary: Radial EBUS localization of the peripheral lesion. Concentric view obtained.

documentation_evidence.snippet: concentric view of the lesion was identified with the radial EBUS

rules_applied.description: Diagnostic bronchoscopy bundled with therapeutic/biopsy codes.
Conventional TBNA bundled into EBUS-TBNA when targeting same lesion.
rules_applied.details: 31629 dropped; 31652 covers the needle aspiration work for this target.

rules_applied.description: Fluoroscopy guidance is included in bronchoscopy codes.
Navigation code requires documented use of EMN/Robotic system.
rules_applied.details: Anatomical guidance only; no navigation system documented.

metadata.notes: Unexpected ICU admission due to airway edema/difficult ventilation.

note_text:
Indications: right lower lobe nodule 
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Medications: General Anesthesia,
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the pre-procedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention.
Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The laryngeal mask airway was in good position. A polyp wasseen on the left vocal cord. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea was of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy were normal; there are no endobronchial lesions. We then removed the diagnostic Q190 bronchoscopy and the super-dimension navigational catheter was inserted through the T190 therapeutic bronchoscope and advanced into the airway. Using navigational map we attempted to advance the 180 degree edge catheter into the proximity of the lesion within the right lower lobe. Confirmation of placement once at the point of interest with radial ultrasound showed a concentric view within the lesion. Biopsies were then performed with a variety of instruments to include peripheral needle, brush, triple needle brush and forceps, under fluoroscopic visualization.  After adequate samples were obtained the bronchoscope was removed and the procedure completed
Complications: No immediate complications
Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 5 cc.
Post Procedure Diagnosis:
- Flexible bronchoscopy with successful navigational biopsy of right lower lobe nodule.  
-Vocal Cord polyp
Recommendations
- Await final pathology
- ENT consultation for eval of vocal cord polyp

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Polyp on left vocal cord. Normal trachea, carina, and bronchial mucosa.

navigation_targets.notes: Biopsies performed with peripheral needle, brush, triple needle brush and forceps.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy; with transendoscopic endobronchial ultrasound (EBUS) during bronchoscopic diagnostic or therapeutic intervention(s) for peripheral lesion(s) (add-on)

per_code.summary: Diagnostic bronchoscopy bundled into surgical bronchoscopy (31628).
Primary code for transbronchial lung biopsy of the peripheral nodule using forceps.

documentation_evidence.snippet: Biopsies were then performed with... forceps

per_code.summary: Navigation add-on supported by documentation of planning and guidance.

documentation_evidence.snippet: super-dimension navigational catheter was inserted... Using navigational map

per_code.summary: Radial EBUS add-on supported by documentation of peripheral lesion localization.

documentation_evidence.snippet: radial ultrasound showed a concentric view

per_code.summary: Bronchial brushing bundled into biopsy of the same lesion per NCCI conventions.
Transbronchial needle aspiration (peripheral needle) bundled into TBLB (31628) when performed on the same lesion per NCCI.

global_comments: Multiple sampling modalities (Forceps, Needle, Brush) on the same peripheral target are typically bundled into the primary biopsy code (31628 TBLB).
